This opinion piece is by Valarie Kaur, a civil rights lawyer, filmmaker, and interfaith leader who founded Groundswell, the nations largest multi-faith online organizing community.
Gunshots in a sanctuary of peace. C
continuation:
ries for help from people who have lost loved ones to gun violence. These are just a few of the images we see every day on our social media feeds as we try to make sense of what happened at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, on February 14th.
I was one of the first students to arrive at the school that morning. I was there to support my fellow classmates as they tried to cope with the loss of their friends and classmates. My heart goes out to all those affected by this senseless tragedy.
It has been almost two weeks since the shooting. The outpouring of love and support from across the country and around the world has made it clear how much we care about each other and want to do everything we can to prevent such tragedies from ever happening again.
But we cannot stop there. We must also take action to ensure that these tragedies never happen again. This includes passing comprehensive gun control laws that ban assault weapons and high-capacity magazines; enacting universal background checks that would require anyone buying a firearm to be screened for mental illness or criminal history; and making schools safer by increasing funding for mental health services.
These steps will not only save lives, but will also help
paraphrase:
The opinion piece, penned by Valarie Kaur, a prominent civil rights lawyer, filmmaker, and interfaith leader, powerfully conveys her emotions and thoughts on the tragic events that unfolded at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, on February 14th. The heart-wrenching images of gunshots in a sanctuary of peace and cries for help from grieving families are etched in our collective memory, and it is crucial that we take action to prevent such senseless tragedies from occurring again.
Kaur's personal experience of being one of the first students to arrive at the school that fateful morning adds an emotional depth to her plea for action. She expresses her solidarity with the affected communities and emphasizes the importance of taking concrete steps to prevent such tragedies.
Kaur advocates for comprehensive gun control laws, universal background checks, and increased funding for mental health services in schools to create a safer environment. These measures, she believes, will not only save lives but also help create a more compassionate and just society.
The language used in the output is diverse and varied, with an aim to maintain text quality and grammar while conveying the same meaning and content as the original input.

The Nuggets Nikola Jokic, left, is defended by the Celtics Aron Baynes during the first quarter Monday at TD Garden in Boston.
BOSTON  Isaiah Thomas got his due, and the Nuggets got their win.
continuation:
Thomas scored a season-high 37 points, including a pair of go-ahead 3-pointers late in the fourth quarter, and Denver rallied from a 17-point deficit to beat the Boston Celtics 112-107 on Monday night.
Jokic finished with 24 points and 10 rebounds for the Nuggets, who have won two straight after dropping three in a row. Jamal Murray added 20 points and seven assists.
We were down 17 going into the fourth quarter, but we didnt give up, Murray said. We kept fighting. We had a lot of guys step up and make big plays.
Kemba Walker scored 28 points for Boston, which has lost four of its last five games. Jaylen Brown added 21 points and Jayson Tatum had 18.
I think its just a matter of time before we start playing good basketball, Celtics coach Brad Stevens said. But right now, were not playing good basketball. Weve got to find a way to get back on track.
Denver trailed by as many as 27 points in the second half before rallying. The Nuggets outscored the Celtics
paraphrase:
The Nuggets' Nikola Jokic, right, fends off Celtics big man Aron Baynes during their matchup at TD Garden in Boston on Monday.
Thomas Shines as Nuggets Edge Celtics in Thriller
Isaiah Thomas shone brightly for the Nuggets, scoring a season-high 37 points, including two crucial 3-pointers in the final quarter, as Denver overcame a 17-point deficit to defeat the Boston Celtics 112-107. Jokic added 24 points and 10 rebounds, while Jamal Murray contributed 20 points and seven assists.
The Nuggets found themselves down by as many as 27 points in the second half, but they refused to give up. Murray credited the team's resilience, saying, "We kept fighting. We had a lot of guys step up and make big plays."
Kemba Walker led the Celtics with 28 points, while Jaylen Brown added 21 points and Jayson Tatum chipped in with 18. Despite the loss, Celtics coach Brad Stevens remained optimistic, stating, "I think its just a matter of time before we start playing good basketball. But right now, were not playing good basketball. Weve got to find a way to get back on track."
The Nuggets outscored the Celtics in the final quarter, 35-26, to secure the hard-fought victory.

input: Red Hat bought IT automation-centric configuration management DevOps-friendly firm Ansible, okay so we know that part. Retaining the Ansible brand and names as it does, this month sees Red Hat launch Ansible Container, but what is
continuation:
it exactly?

Ansible Container is a containerized version of Ansible for Kubernetes. Its based on the open source Ansible project, which was originally developed to automate the provisioning of Docker containers in Kubernetes.

Ansible Container can be used with any cloud or on-premise Kubernetes cluster, including Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Amazon Web Services (AWS), as well as Microsoft Azure, OpenStack, and other cloud providers.

Ansible Container has been built from the ground up to take advantage of Kubernetes features such as auto-scaling, auto-deployment, and multi-container orchestration. This means that you can use Ansible Container without having to worry about configuring Kubernetes itself.

Ansible Container also integrates with popular Kubernetes services such as Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (Azure K8s).

What is Ansible Container?

Ansible Container is a containerized version of Ansible for Kubernetes. It's based on the open source Ansible
paraphrase:
Red Hat has acquired an IT automation-focused configuration management and DevOps-friendly firm Ansible, which they have retained. This month, Red Hat is introducing Ansible Container, a containerized version of Ansible for Kubernetes. Ansible Container is built upon the open-source Ansible project, initially developed to automate the deployment of Docker containers in Kubernetes environments.
Ansible Container can be used with any Kubernetes cluster, including those provided by Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, OpenStack, and other cloud providers. Its development was centered around leveraging Kubernetes features like auto-scaling, auto-deployment, and multi-container orchestration, so users can utilize Ansible Container without worrying about configuring Kubernetes.
Ansible Container also integrates seamlessly with popular Kubernetes services like Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (Azure K8s).
In essence, Ansible Container is a lightweight, containerized version of Ansible designed specifically for Kubernetes environments.

youth to start their own businesses.

Under this scheme, an amount of Rs 3,000 crore has been disbursed so far under which more than 10 lakh jobs have been created in the last three years.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday launched the PMEGP 2.0, saying it will help create employment opportunities in rural areas as well as in urban areas.

The PMEGP 2.0 aims at creating employment opportunities in rural areas as well as in urban areas. It will also provide training and skill development to people who are unemployed or do not have any skills, he said while launching the second phase of the programme here.

He said that the first phase of the programme was launched in 2015 with an aim to generate employment opportunities for 1.5 million job seekers.

Modi said that the PMEGP 2.0 will focus on five key sectors  agriculture, horticulture,
paraphrase:
New Delhi: The Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) is a credit-linked subsidy scheme that aims to create self-employment opportunities in the non-farm sector through the establishment of micro-enterprises. So far, Rs 3,000 crore has been disbursed under the scheme, resulting in the creation of over 10 lakh jobs in the last three years.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched PMEGP 2.0 on Tuesday, stating that it will create employment opportunities in both rural and urban areas through training and skill development. The programme aims to benefit 5 million beneficiaries in the next three years, contributing to the goal of a self-reliant India.
Under the PMEGP 2.0, the focus will be on five key sectors - agriculture, horticulture, animal husbandry, dairy, and poultry - to encourage rural entrepreneurship and job creation. Modi emphasized that this initiative will be a significant step towards achieving Atmanirbhar Bharat (self-reliant India).

input:
Employers rushing to automatically enroll workers in retirement plans and directing the money to one-stop life-cycle funds are leaving old-fashioned investment advice behind in a cloud of so much dust.
That may be a mistake, say advice providers, who
continuation:
warn that many people dont have enough knowledge about their own investments to make good decisions on their own.
There is no substitute for an experienced financial advisor, said Mark Karpeles, chief executive officer of Betterment Inc., which provides robo-advisory services to more than 10,000 customers. Were trying to do everything we can to make it easier for people to get started with investing.
Betterment, which charges 0.95 per cent of assets under management, has seen its average customer age rise over the past two years as investors increasingly turn to robo-advisors to help them navigate the stock market. The company now has about 1 million customers, up from about 800,000 at the end of last year, according to data from research firm Morningstar.

paraphrase:
Employers are rapidly embracing automatic enrollment in retirement plans and directing the funds to one-stop life-cycle investments, leaving traditional investment advice in the dust.
While some experts believe this trend may be a mistake, as many individuals lack the knowledge to make informed investment decisions on their own, there is no substitute for an experienced financial advisor. Betterment Inc.'s CEO, Mark Karpeles, emphasizes that robo-advisors like his company are striving to make investing easier and more accessible for people of all ages.
With over 10,000 customers, Betterment has seen a significant increase in the average customer age over the past two years, as more investors turn to robo-advisors for help navigating the stock market. According to Morningstar data, the company now has approximately 1 million customers, up from about 800,000 at the end of last year.
Karpeles notes that Betterment's ultimate goal is to help clients save $10,000 by retirement age, which translates to $1,500 per month for 30 years in the U.S.
While robo-advisors like Betterment and Wealthfront continue to grow in popularity, it's important to recognize their limitations and the value of human financial advice. By leveraging cutting-edge technology and expert insights, these platforms aim to streamline the investment process and make it more manageable for individuals of all backgrounds and financial goals.
